pr_title: Update the contentDirectoryMonitor appender configuration in org.ops4j.pax.logging.cfg to match the configuration in log4j2.xml

timeline.message: Update the contentDirectoryMonitor appender configuration in org.ops4j.pax.logging.cfg to match the configuration in log4j2.xml

timeline.bodyText:
@SmithJosh, I'm starting a thread to reply to #6344 (review)
The xml-style didn't work in the itests. Also, we decided to keep maintaining both here (rather than just use the cfg-style in the itests) because there was some karaf console bug with the xml-style config, which make the cfg-style config preferable for devs who don't need to harden. Lastly, there was a bug with the failover appender that made it so that we needed to use the xml-style if you wanted failover logging, which is part of hardening. These issues might have been fixed since I last worked with these files, but iirc, those were the motivations for this decision.

  
    
      ddf/distribution/ddf-common/src/main/resources/etc/org.ops4j.pax.logging.cfg
    
    
        Lines 20 to 24
      in
      bfbd3b4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           # In order to switch to the xml-style configuration for Log4j2 in ${karaf.etc}/log4j2.xml, 
        

        
          
           # uncomment the following line and remove all the configuration beneath it. This change has not been 
        

        
          
           # made default because the xml-style configuration causes log entries to be missing from the itests. 
        

        
          
           # However, because failover logging capabilities are only available for the xml-style configuration, 
        

        
          
           # this step is required for security hardening.
timeline.author: emmberk

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the explanation. Always wondered about that. The log4j config seems much better all around: well known format, easier to read (imo), and the lines don't get randomly sorted when you go to edit it. But that makes sense
